title: Old Fashioned "The"
content:
This is a throw back to hand-lettered signage, but I know that you can get these with font packages nowadays. Anyone have any ideas what this might be from?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101203040939im_/http:/typophile.com/files/the_6158.jpg)
author: sshuman

comments.content:
I know for a fact it's not this typeface, but Bello, by underware, has a wonderful brush font that includes a special 'words' set, and this is what this reminded me of so you might also be interested in Bello:

[Bello Words @ underware.nl](http://web.archive.org/web/20101203040939/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php?id1=bello&id2=words)

That's really close to the direction I'm looking for. Do you (or anyone else) know if there is a type term used for these kind of "word" sets? I know I've heard of it, but it's escaping my mind right now.

Thanks for your help!

You may also want to have a look at [Metroscript](http://web.archive.org/web/20101203040939/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/alphabetsoup/metroscript/). As far as I know, they are just called "words" or "word logos".
That's it! Thank you so much for all your help. Everyone's expertise and knowledge here in these forums is so valuable. Thanks.
Is your avatar inspired by Least Wanted?
